intro: Hylaeaicum meeanum, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, preferring well-drained soils and cool, moist environments. Its leaves are thick and waxy, which helps it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Hylaeaicum meeanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
